thread.title: Today Show broadcast live from Moffat Beach this morning
thread.title_full: Today Show broadcast live from Moffat Beach this morning

title: Today Show broadcast live from Moffat Beach this morning
text:
Today Show broadcast live from Moffat Beach this morning Kathy Sundstrom | 1st Oct 2015 5:00 AM Updated: 6:46 AM Kathy Sundstrom Cars For Sale 
UPDATE 6AM: 
LOCALS have flocked to Moffat Beach to greet the stars from The Today Show this morning. 
Hosts Karl Stefanovic and Lisa Wilkinson watched the sun rise over the water before fans joined them in Caloundra. Good morning to you from Moffat Beach! #Today9 pic.twitter.com/q0XvAHvdp2 — The Today Show (@TheTodayShow) September 30, 2015 
Karl and Richard Wilkins couldn't believe how many fans had joined them. 
"What a beautiful crowd we've got here," Karl said. 
"I can't believe how many people were here as we went to air," Richard said. 
Richard also appreciated the love some residents had specifically for him. — The Today Show (@TheTodayShow) September 30, 2015 
Richard promptly found the granny in question. There she is! Such an awesome crowd this morning! @RichardWilkins loving it! We Love Sunshine Coast! #Today9 pic.twitter.com/BNzG8jQtRQ — The Today Show (@TheTodayShow) September 30, 2015 
He also spent some time with the nippers from Dicky Beach Surf Life Saving Club. Lol! @RichardWilkins loves this surf club, wonder why?! #Today9 pic.twitter.com/FxIthGzPAu — The Today Show (@TheTodayShow) September 30, 2015 
Sunshine Coast Council were also impressed with the hundreds of Sunshine Coasters who turned out to make the show welcome. The cameras are rolling for @TheTodayShow . #SunshineCoast is putting on an awesome welcome. pic.twitter.com/dOR31ZQuqo — SunshineCoastCouncil (@CouncilSCC) September 30, 2015 
EARLIER: 
THE eyes of 350,000 people will be on the Sunshine Coast this morning as Karl Stefanovic and Lisa Wilkinson broadcast their popular morning television show live from Moffat Beach. Karl Stefanovic arrives at Sunshine Coast airport all kitted up. john mccutcheon 
One only hopes that Karl has changed from the short black Adidas running shorts and slightly small sandals and cowboy hat he wore when arriving to a red carpet at the Sunshine Coast Airport. 
The blue suit Karl wore every morning for an entire year was gone, he said it was "packed away" as he embraced the "warmest welcome from anywhere in the world". Lisa also appeared amazed as she walked along the carpet to the tunes of the Shake it Up music band. SUPERSTAR WELCOME: Nine's breakfast show hosts Karl Stefanovic and Lisa Wilkinson arrive at Sunshine Coast Airport. john mccutcheon 
Both television personalities took the time to be photographed with the young band members and their family in the airport welcome lounge. 
Karl and Lisa were gracious enough to be interviewed twice after problems with audio on the tarmac. 
They were thrilled to be showcasing the Sunshine Coast for their "We love Australia Tour". 
For Karl, a visit to the region has been a long time coming. 
"I've been here for 60 Minutes interviews, but it's probably been about 15 to 20 years since I spent the night," he said. 
Lisa, on the other hand, is a familiar face. 
"I spent my honeymoon here (to media personality Pete FitzSimons)," she said. 
"I try to come back at least once a year." 
Karl was hoping to take in a kite surf yesterday afternoon, but with storm clouds brewing and his skills sorely lacking, he admitted it probably wouldn't happen. 
He was looking forward to enjoying the food from our restaurants and "catching up with locals". 
"The best part of what we do is promoting parts of Australia to Australians," he said. 
He was impressed with how "green" the Sunshine Coast was from the air. 
But then again, he had just travelled from drought-stricken Longreach. 
Karl and Lisa were also challenged with the task of milking a cow from Maleny Dairy in the Hinterland to the beach for an on-air milking session, while Spicers Clovelly chef Cameron Matthews used the best Mooloolaba seafood to cook up a distinctively local breakfast barbecue. The Today Show will be broadcast from 5.30am at Moffat Beach. entertainment
